block.p: Christina Carmody Millones, the daughter of Deirdre Carmody Millones and Peter Millones of Narragansett, R.I., was married there yesterday to Brian Richard Clifford, a son of the late Ann and Paul Clifford of Lewiston, Me. The Rev. Richard Clifford, an uncle of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More.

The bride, 29, is an account executive in Philadelphia for Rightscenter.com, an online clearinghouse for intellectual property. She and the bridegroom graduated from Bowdoin College. Her parents, who are retired, worked at The New York Times, her father as an assistant managing editor and a metropolitan editor and her mother as a reporter.

Christina Carmody Millones, the daughter of Deirdre Carmody Millones and Peter Millones of Narragansett, R.I., was married there yesterday to Brian Richard Clifford, a son of the late Ann and Paul Clifford of Lewiston, Me. The Rev. Richard Clifford, an uncle of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More.

The bride, 29, is an account executive in Philadelphia for Rightscenter.com, an online clearinghouse for intellectual property. She and the bridegroom graduated from Bowdoin College. Her parents, who are retired, worked at The New York Times, her father as an assistant managing editor and a metropolitan editor and her mother as a reporter.

The bridegroom, 29, is studying for an M.B.A. at the University of Pennsylvania. His father was a salesman at Maine Wholesale Tire in Portland. His mother taught the second grade at the Gov. James B. Longley Elementary School in Lewiston.
